p:
The basic reproduction number,
R 0
, is defined as the number of new infections produced by one infected individual in a completely susceptible population. When the population is not fully susceptible, or more than one person is infected, then the effective reproduction number,
R
e f f
( t )
, estimates the number of secondary cases produced by a typical infected individual at any time during the epidemic. We derived the effective reproduction number from infectious point of view for DENV, ZIKV, and CHIKV to estimate the reproduction rate of an epidemic at any stage.
